document.title: Maryland Early Learning Standards Birth – 8 Years

FD6F45CFB2F34C8AA154505C7F7AF16C.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversation, being read to, and responding to text.

D92FF82FD22047A1ADC3FA9818148E4F.description: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

08E0346806844878A395675071EA3519.description:
Identify reallife connections
between words and
their use (e.g., note
objects in classroom
that are small).

921EFB0EE19A48BDBF72C8564CFC167D.description:
With modeling
and support,
demonstrate
understanding of
frequently occurring
verbs and adjectives
by relating them to
their opposites
(antonyms).

CCB3439459FE4787B5F35DCB1F091D8B.description: With modeling and support, sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

0CFA9F6396CC4917AE2D4729D0F0441A.description: With modeling and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

D1D633A2489147A4AEBA0766A495A1D3.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

CE1B77DA126744C49123D1CAB10A648F.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown words and phrases based on pre-kindergarten reading and content.

826D00BF388441A9B16A44D9807F2498.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

FAAFDDDB481A4AB9A2BAF7A09BC986FF.description:
Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for
meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

4406EB19FCB44A59B3E2817047D3127B.description:
Develop fine
motor skills
necessary to control and sustain handwriting.

361F3C0E912D4B079E5C059CA56BFB52.description:
Use letter-like
shapes, symbols,
letters, and words to
convey meaning.

F526AACD18894B93A8D035567ADF82E9.description:
Demonstrate
awareness of name
and function of end
punctuation (e.g.,
period, question
mark and
exclamation point).

B6FAC551BB5A43E6BC4A99BA0E9472E4.description:
Recognize that
their name begins
with a capital letter.

DFFFD4FAD11F4AF3BBFB66CEB5C70BCF.description:
Gain exposure to
conventions of
standard English
capitalization,
punctuation, and
spelling during
shared reading and
writing experiences.

45B3515044EA445E9AF8750D7992BEEB.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

69428B32544248EE88C1C98A6C73F121.description:
Produce
complete sentences
in shared language
activities.

DA700F2FA5984711A747C0864D5F1790.description:
Gain exposure
to the most
frequently occurring
prepositions (e.g.,
to, from, in, out, on,
off, for, of, by,
with).

854735E47DAA4C97BC429B4C9C94C167.description:
Understand
and begin to use
question words (e.g.,
interrogatives such
as who, what, where,
when, why, how).

BFD08F7B21564ACA93F6489B25479655.description:
Develop
understanding of singular and plural
nouns (e.g., dog
means one dog;
dogs means more
than one dog).

04980BB6BCA040AC8924374A4A191E91.description:
Use frequently
occurring nouns and
verbs.

BE446D494E9F4407B6B9F6BA60B95E8D.description:
Print upper
and lowercase letters
in first name.

FBBD4FF3F6124F408523B751E84B787F.description:
Demonstrate beginning understanding of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when engaged in literacy activities (e.g. Interactive Read Alouds, shared reading, shared writing, developmentally appropriate writing,
oral language
activities, etc.).

0651A8AA7E4A4FE19D2C7D53F0A3B511.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

23D1E1FFA03F42CDA69FC7AAEE754A42.description:
With modeling
and support, speak
audibly and express
thoughts, feelings,
and ideas clearly.

7FA5166AEC664FD09EA175DCE64B2A22.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when
indicated or appropriate.

10815D9E10F64601B065D6D7009B187E.description: Add drawings or visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

6AE482EC0044468B82625D4FDB418452.description: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

49B4A554EBA0420889608F981C7F5AC6.description:
Describe
familiar people,
places, things, and
events with
modeling and
support.

CCD2F041CD754D919BA4994CBE200614.description:
Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the
organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

831BFFFFBB82442E9E4D7D319DFF0B15.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

7C07A44A9451485A803B8E8EAE2A7F2A.description: Evaluate a speaker’s point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

31309B82B7664CE4B9A3FF6AF0113DA0.description:
Confirm
understanding of
text read aloud or
information
presented orally or
through other media
by asking and
answering questions
about key details
with modeling and
support.

62E837B3E3C341C0977E230FD8F69058.description: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

D7A4665E5B7E468F8890BB493C1A1E5F.description:
During
scaffolded
conversations,
continue a
conversation
through multiple
exchanges.

2A52E059575C4047B11598A3CCD60E16.description:
Follow
agreed-upon rules
for discussions (e.g.,
listening to others
and taking turns,
speaking about the
topics and texts
under discussion).

57C51FAA96724A36836BA4D2B3CD07CE.description:
Participate in
collaborative
conversations with
diverse partners
about prekindergarten topics
and texts with peers
and adults in small
and larger groups.

92795293767C4EDE9A720AD5B98F4056.description:
Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on
others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

D58CEAE6AB9845B49A5D0C9B70BE1200.description: With modeling and support from adult, recall information from experiences or information from provided sources to answer a question.

5E73B5DFB42042B2AA749CD21AB68707.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

B3E9C08D92D74A409D7A81FDB9CE9590.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

C88EE3EA2A0A4965A29837ECDF967B44.description:
Participate in
shared research and
shared writing
projects.

C35189BD9207469E855F5FFF6EA49F66.description:
Research to Build
and Present
Knowledge

C77417C73B07477FAF6149254F76DC8D.description:
Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of
the subject under investigation.

CEFC834D7E1F4CC09A93736B2F2129BC.description: With prompting and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to express ideas.

A1B8C663DC7740BCBAD22B4FE2558010.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

7DF00C3C538A4D01926409C2B54606FF.description:
With modeling,
guidance, and
support from adults,
review drawing,
dictation or
developmentally
appropriate writing.

D13DCA8F869D42BF913CD88E7CDBAD05.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

8A5D3AF8FDF1485DB263BBCE225CCA70.description: With modeling and support, use a combination of drawing, dictating, or developmentally appropriate writing to communicate a personal story about a single event and tell about the event in a meaningful sequence.

2E4E0BFACF6E443B8082910A5D87F0D0.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.

F43BE8D4EFE34924930B9D44FFCC8F86.description:
Use a
combination of
drawing, dictating,
or developmentally
appropriate writing
to state information
on a topic.

832D9B02B0B24025A1CD96EC73CC1840.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately
through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

000F8A67A48A4A33B4C65FE6497B279B.description: With modeling and support, use a combination of drawing, dictating, and developmentally appropriate writing to share opinion about an experience or book.

0972AC0BE5474532B5FDC0B589B04A53.description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

6359E56F3814473784C4D1DAF85B2096.description:
Engage with a
variety of texts (e.g.,
a variety of
structures and/or
genres) with
purpose and
understanding.

30DD5CE58617415EB1CB682A3F366C92.description:
Engage with a variety of texts with purpose and understanding. Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support
 comprehension.

5AE0EAB5109040A58110B4F779B24105.description:
Recognize
name in print as
well as some
environmental print
(symbols/words).

39FA325A47634C6EB1C57B3F0C68392E.description:
Demonstrate basic
knowledge of oneto-one letter sound
correspondences by
producing the most
frequent sound for
some consonants.

C30DCCEC4A6D41249814D7599CF664DA.description:
Recognize
that words are
made up of letters
and their sounds.

2CFBFBCFC4A0450DA03EA32A412F6F75.description: Know and apply grade- level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

2903C0756F9F48CEA751AC40470C7533.description: Orally blend and segment individual phonemes in two- to-three phoneme words.

5D061A03ABFD4457AA7EDA3B1185A762.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial sound in spoken words.

8CF502D874ED4805A7D00D71129998CA.description:
Blend and
segment onsets and
rimes of single-syllable spoken
words.

58A8E449422246CA9DDCD06B17EBF156.description:
Count,
pronounce, blend,
and segment
syllables in spoken
words.

81B904E4C3404D72833268998A863387.description:
Identify and
isolate individual
words in a spoken
sentence.

DC53E5ED56594CE9A0A582F250A7483B.description:
Recognize
rhyming words in
spoken language.

0DBF7A298C25446585700CFA3A4BB0ED.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

780BF42199464C5BBF25C33CBA58AB73.description:
Recognize
and name some
upper and
lowercase letters of
the alphabet.

0CCB50047F284FF48288FDE86D4ED956.description:
Understand
that words are
separated by spaces
in print.

DAD5C69C1E834B278FC4D3E500CDE764.description: Recognize that spoken words can be written and read.

3B4C5DC3EF7049768FC4ECE173ED0F69.description: Demonstrate an awareness that words are read from left to right, top to bottom and page by page.

64BF88FD033D48C7900AEFE7F19F0452.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

458AECCFC8AB48BFA07A45378E04819B.description:
Actively
engage in group
reading activities
with purpose and
understanding.

5D5576FFB4C040C798D05D374A6D47B0.description:
Range of
Reading and Level
of Text Complexity

AF9AAF848F354DC085B48487D411930A.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

35205C6A771B43918F2F6597777980D3.description: With prompting and support, discuss similarities and differences between two texts on the same topic (i.e. in illustrations or descriptions).

3A46B0FDDE044BF7A595850F4A3BB239.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

D4D2E20812764DC9BE3DEF07327B60F1.description:
With modeling
and support identify
the reasons an
author gives to
support points in a
text.

051E4A39DE8F46649C30511E64C9DCEE.description:
Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the
relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

4C02B5215E5C44C0B1600D7C3DEB4A2F.description: With modeling and support, tell how the illustrations/photogr aphs support the text.

086491908FD445969626D684DADED328.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.*

ABA9070D9D6740B3906BDD0CEDE42859.description:
With modeling
and support define
the role of the
author and
illustrator/photogra
pher in presenting
the ideas or
information in a
text.

51DF6431423C405BA53DAB514E4E417C.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text

FADC04BF37C7457EA52F51922A8812B7.description: With modeling and support identify the front cover, and back cover of a book.

F19D31E7747842668F40BEC606918A17.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

497B46F009274356A6962B2EDA4FA9B9.description:
With modeling
and support,
answer questions
about unknown
words in a text.

A34BFEDDA92847E4A529E51A9B6904EF.description:
Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative
meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

476F8D4FC860403F894B9C850521C2C4.description: With modeling and support, connect individuals, events, and pieces of information in text to life experiences.

47DDEF9F6517433494DFED2A9F146C75.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of text

A799DE21A6D3442B97F8896A5F13E4B8.description:
With modeling
and support, recall
one or more
detail(s) related to
the main topic from
an informational
text.

3F400981DFE24C87B7D670B2B94D9ABF.description:
Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and
ideas.

FA4A50D3BEB744E2BBAC90242B4C3A74.description: With modeling and support, answer questions about details in an informational text.

0E2271F3124246878C3387E8DCC99DA8.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

3F66CE067A63432FBC79FE8F1C2243AA.description:
Actively
engage in group
reading activities
with purpose and
understanding.

995B9234400543B1AF30111E83E10E20.description:
Range of
Reading and Level
of Text Complexity

6457AFE89E224EA48B3541CBE006E96F.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

8381C1CF4B1B4AFF87314873B3EF4317.description: With modeling and support, compare adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

DC6A0B238408412D9C8DFFD438B689E4.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

50ABC0244DD841E787870FD2481D009E.description:
With modeling
and support, tell
how the illustrations
support the story.

475D35621EA44188A9BC7B2BF06854E2.description:
Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in
words.*

7A0BF39ED4D343118CF87F7A9A2A5420.description: With modeling and support, identify the role of author and illustrator.

CA4C06738E914C1D80F80EF80DA0B202.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

2F44E034E3084CC6BC6033FCC6F10B0F.description:
Gain
exposure to
common types of
literary texts (e.g.,
storybooks,
poems).

7E55A7FC53F44ED4B62F5B2F1FB3EBBD.description:
Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a
section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

EAD20339CC754B64A5D906DD71448087.description: With modeling and support, answer questions about unknown words in stories and poems.

A79566B598C441B9A38158A80D36FB67.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

F1029015A4E547EBB959F6A1A4A74BC9.description:
With
modeling and
support, identify
characters, settings
and major events in
a story.

34587256CC374194ACFADDAAF14227EA.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of text.

209B4E93C9F3489E8A12042CCCE1A5C6.description: With modeling and support, retell familiar stories/poems.

2B465080DB2F43139FAEB24E344163AD.description: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

BDCE38A8A68048F88395BED587944117.description:
With
modeling and
prompting, answer
questions about
details in a text.

5A851386288A4E1CAFB193F735D624D5.description:
Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual
evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
